marklogic.body: Later in the day I post this as Jeff randall's brilliant article in today's Telegraph has had so liittle notice except from Elaine and Anne above. It's now 3.30 so this will hit the dead Spot for this particular comment thread. His article starts by examining the actual and projected growth in our debts from the present £1trillion to £1.4 trn . By 2016-17 interest alone on our debts will be around £70bn . That's money down the drain . He examines state spending to see how we got there from £450 bn (adjusted for inflation)to £700 bn today .. First the NHS went up by 140% partly to fund new drugs with the result we lived longer and that put pensions by 78%. He adds "As a political proposition, cutting the NHS’s outlay in order to kill our elderly is unlikely to win votes, so we need to look elsewhere for - - - savings. Brown opened the floodgates of welfare spending in 2002 -07 (+40%) and protected the unjustified bonanza by changing the definitions of poverty and (he adds) "“Fairness” is stuck on every Act of income redistribution like a supermarket price label. Those who question the recipients’ needs are branded “callous” -0 - -Opponents of responsible spending talk of bringing back the 50p tax rate (which raised just £1 billion) and a new bankers’ bonus levy (£3-4 billion) as if they alone might solve our debt problems. This is ludicrous. To achieve a balanced budget, we need much less spending. We cannot tax our way to prosperity" Do read for yourselves PLEASE:- http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/comment/jeffra...
